title: Creole–Maple Air Fryer Chicken (1.5 lbs)
instructions: Cut chicken breast into 1–1.5 inch pieces.
In a bowl, combine the oil, Creole seasoning, garlic powder, maple syrup, lemon juice, and optional smoked paprika.
Add chicken and toss until well-coated. Marinate for 15–30 minutes.
Place chicken in a single layer in the air fryer basket.
Cook for 8–10 minutes, shaking or turning halfway through.
Check internal temperature; remove when chicken reaches 160°F and let rest for 3–5 minutes to finish at 165°F.
Cool slightly, then chop for use in salads or bowls.
notes: If cooking whole chicken breasts instead of chunks, cook 9–12 minutes per side at 380°F.
Pairs especially well with arugula, sweet potato, carrots, and black beans.
